definition:
[**Definition.**]{} Let $\{(X_i,x_i)\}_{i\in I}$ be a finite family of
disjoint pointed topological spaces. The *wedge product* of these spaces
is

$$\bigvee_{i\in I} X_i = \left(\bigcup_{i\in I} X_i\right) / \{x_i: i\in I\}.$$

This can be generalized to arbitrary families of pointed topological
spaces, although this may require that the topology on
$\bigcup_{i\in I} X_i$ satisfy a coherence condition (see [@Munkres]).

[9]{} Munkres, J. R. (2000). *Topology* (2nd. ed.). Upper Saddle River,
NJ: Prentice Hall. Prasolov, V. V. (2004). *Elements of combinatorial
and differential topology*. Providence, RI: American Mathematical
Society. Shick, P. L. (2007). *Topology: Point-set and geometric*.
Hoboken, NJ: John Wiley & Sons.
phrase: Wedge Product Of Pointed Topological Spaces
